fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Customs, Energy, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Sport
eu_initiatives: Main focus is on the Digital Single Market, including copyright, audiovisual media, electronic communications, e-commerce, competition, consumer rights and privacy. We also follow environmental files, in particular those linked to Ocean health.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: Amilhat#Jean-Baptiste, Ciullo#Stefano, FRIEDLAENDER#Daniel, Flecken#Eva, GERLIS BLEIER#Nicole, Mittestainer#Alberto
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: High-Level Expert Group on Fake News#E03567#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3567#Member#C#Sub Group 3 B Role and responsibilities of news media organizations/broadcasters
goals__remit:
Sky is Europe's leading entertainment company, serving 22 million customers across six countries: UK, Ireland, Germany, Austria, Italy and Spain. We offer the best and broadest range of content, deliver market-leading customer service and use innovative new technology to give customers a better TV experience, whenever and wherever they choose. 
 
Sky has annual revenues of over £12 billion and is Europe's leading investor in television content with a combined programming budget of over £5.2 billion. The group employs 30,000 people and is listed on the London Stock Exchange (SKY). 
 
For more information visit www.sky.com/corporate
